Moving to New York

May 31, 2019

My partner is moving to NYC for school. Naturally, Iâ€™ve started compiling of things to see, eat, and do over the next year.

See

On my list are a few of the usual suspects:

  • The Guggenheim
  • MoMA (will just miss a very cool Chinese landscapes exhibition)
  • Whitney (the Mehretu exhibition looks great, and their collection looks amazing)
  • Doyer Street
  • Printed Matter (art bookstore)

Eat

  • Russ & Daughters
  • Grand Central Oyster Bar & Restaurant
  • Momofuku Milk Bar
  • Ample Hills Creamery

Do

  • Shui
  • Django (live jazz)

Of Note

  • NY diners are mostly gone because their large menus make them much more expensive to start and run compared to high-end restaurants [link]
  • Culture Pass is a way to visit many NYC attractions for free. Requires advanced booking.

  • The Skint is a great newsletter for free/inexpensive things to do in NYC
